pullRequest.title: Add SPI to configure additional bootstrap package prefixes
pullRequest.bodyText:
This feature is useful when a large set of custom instrumentations is
using common classes from a custom package.
cc) @trask
Signed-off-by: Pavol Loffay p.loffay@gmail.com

nodes.bodyText: I could get around without introducing this class. In the AgentInstaller I have set the package prefixes to the config (in the static block) and then used the config in the classloader instrumentation. We could also remove the SPI so vendors would set the packages in the config - I don't like this since it easily opens the config to the consumers.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,27 @@ +/* + * Copyright The OpenTelemetry Authors + * SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 + */ + +package io.opentelemetry.instrumentation.api.config; + +/** + * {@link BootstrapPackagePrefixesHolder} in an utility class that holds package prefixes. The + * classes from these packages are pushed to the bootstrap classloader. + * + *

The prefixes are loaded by {@code AgentInstaller} and consumed by classloader instrumentation. + * The instrumentation does not have access to the installer, therefore this utility class is used + * to share package prefixes. + */ +public class BootstrapPackagePrefixesHolder {

nodes.bodyText: can this go in javaagent-bootstrap near HelperResources which serves somewhat similar purpose?

nodes.bodyText: Is Config not available here? If it is, we can just use a config property instead of a separate SPI?
Can you make this class more similar to Config/OpenTelemetrySdkAccess? I.e. volatile static field, internal... setter method name, checking that you can only set the value once.

The + * classes from these packages are pushed to the bootstrap classloader. + * + *

nodes.bodyText: If it's supposed to be available in instrumentation-api consider using a List (and Collections.unmodifiableList() wrapper): arrays are mutable and can be easily changed by anybody.

commit.message:
Add SPI to configure additional bootstrap package prefixes

This feature is useful when a large set of custom instrumentations is
using common classes from a custom package.

Signed-off-by: Pavol Loffay <p.loffay@gmail.com>

Review comments and move holder to internal package

Signed-off-by: Pavol Loffay <p.loffay@gmail.com>

beforeCommit.message:
Review comments and move holder to internal package

Signed-off-by: Pavol Loffay <p.loffay@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: Just a minor comment: how about internalSetBootstrapPackagePrefixes?
